definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: He is a bachelor; once he is fed no one is hungry in his family.
sentences.chinese: 他是光棍儿一条，一人吃饱全家不饿。

sentences.english: My brother met his girlfriend at a party on Singles' Day.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥在光棍儿节聚会上遇到了他的女朋友。

sentences.english: Are you going to remain single all your life?
sentences.chinese: 打算这么一直打光棍儿？

sentences.english: Singleness can be a time for many opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 作为光棍儿，可以碰到很多机会的。

sentences.english: Your time as a single person may be the only time that you have to fulfill your dreams.
sentences.chinese: 你作光棍儿的时间很可能正是你实现梦想的时间。

definition: young people in their late 20s or older who are still unmarried
Singles' Day (November 11), originally a day of activities for single people, but now also the world's biggest annual retail sales day
lit. fifth child of the Wangs/bachelor
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
erhua variant of 爺們|爷们[ye2 men5]
menfolk (collective term for men of different generations)/husbands and their fathers etc
